channel.title: 608's+ Compiling and Running errors on windows 7
channel.description:
Difficulty 0/10 just knowledge on how to read, use a .bat and download things
[size=8pt]Some times you get an error just because of an anti leech, but if you are one of those people who get an error on everything 608+ then you need to give this a look.[/size]
First thing you need to do is update you're Jdk version (make sure you pick 64 bit system, and it ends up in Program Files, not Program Files (x86))
[size=8pt]My jdk path: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk[/size]
Then update your Jre make sure Jre ends up in Program Files (x86) not Program Files.
[size=8pt]My JRE path: C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre[/size]
then repath your .bat files to what you just downloaded.
[size=8pt]Step 1. Open up the run.bat on the server Step 2. you will see something like this: [code]@echo off title runserver java -Xmx815m -cp bin;lib/*; com.rs.Launcher true true false pause[/code] [size=8pt]Step 3. Find your path to jre [code]"C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jreVERSION/bin/java.exe[/code] [size=8pt]Step 4. Add in your path and delete the java line as so: [code]@echo off title runserver "C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jreVERSION/bin/java.exe" -Xmx815m -cp bin;lib/*; com.rs.Launcher true true false pause[/code] [size=8pt]Step 5. You're done![/size]
What this fixes: dropEditor.java (75ish errors), an error in the alex folder, Cache error. And I am sure a few others I did not encounter.
This IS the windows 7 fix for a lot of unanswered questions I've seen across google.

item.title: 608's+ Compiling and Running errors on windows 7
item.dc:creator: @llcoolchris llcoolchris
item.description:
@llcoolchris wrote:

Difficulty 0/10 just knowledge on how to read, use a .bat and download things

[size=8pt]Some times you get an error just because of an anti leech, but if you are one of those people who get an error on everything 608+ then you need to give this a look.[/size]

First thing you need to do is update you’re Jdk version (make sure you pick 64 bit system, and it ends up in Program Files, not Program Files (x86))

[size=8pt]My jdk path: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk[/size]

Then update your Jre make sure Jre ends up in Program Files (x86) not Program Files.

[size=8pt]My JRE path: C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre[/size]

then repath your .bat files to what you just downloaded.

[size=8pt]Step 1. Open up the run.bat on the server
Step 2. you will see something like this:

@echo off title runserver java -Xmx815m -cp bin;lib/*; com.rs.Launcher true true false pause
[size=8pt]Step 3. Find your path to jre

[size=8pt]Step 4. Add in your path and delete the java line as so:

@echo off title runserver "C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jreVERSION/bin/java.exe" -Xmx815m -cp bin;lib/*; com.rs.Launcher true true false pause
[size=8pt]Step 5. You’re done![/size]

What this fixes: dropEditor.java (75ish errors), an error in the alex folder, Cache error. And I am sure a few others I did not encounter.

This IS the windows 7 fix for a lot of unanswered questions I’ve seen across google.
